title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: John W. Jordan to Orlando Brown, July 31, 1868
summary: Jordan remarks that he observes different opinions regarding the legal rights of blacks among different classes of people, but notes that "intelligence, integrity or moral courage" do not appear to be qualifications necessary to sit on a jury or preside as a Magistrate in Augusta County.
keywords: Administration/Bureaucracy, Legal System, Race Relations, Violence/Crime, American Civil War
